page.title: 17Water Power
page.content: In the past water power was one of the major sources of power in our rectangle.A water wheel in our area that still works when sufficient water is supplied is to be found at Newmills.This water wheel was made by T.Coombe and Sons.It was made in 1905 and is capable of generating 18 horse power.It is about 18 feet aross and weighs 2 tons.The water wheel is made of cast iron.The mill itself was used for grinding corn.In order to get water to the water wheel a leat was constructed.This is still visible though it is now filled with an assortment of rubbish.
